reviews.review: Don't believe the critics, if you are a Star Wars fan, you will enjoy this movie. It fixed a lot from the crap that was last Jedi and actually made last Jedi better. Minor things I would change but overall a blast and I definitely recommend.
Repairs some of the damage done by The Last Jedi
If you are a true Star Wars fan, this movie is just what we needed. It overcame and undid what Rian Johnson messed up in the last movie.

Being old enough to have grown up to the original trilogy, and having read most of the now Legends stories, I had issues with sequels story/ character choices. The Disney writers put themselves in a hole because of their lack connective vision. I hope to never see JJ Abrams attached to another Star Wars project. It started slow but finished strong .  The story arcs of main characters just werent flushed out, it felt like they were just trying to salvage something (Rey). Bringing back the Palpatine with little to no explanation was lazy.  I like the flash to Leias training, it gave everyone some brief idea that she was a potent force user.  The Lucas story group should have been allowed to shape this trilogy. They would have done so much better. It could  have then become what it SHOULD have been. It is the best of the sequel trilogy, but in the end that is what it should have been.

Went into it with no expectations. A life-long love of Star Wars has been disappointed so often that the excitement was gone.  But it was amazing.  Action, Comedy, Tears. Fan-Service, yes, but not the cheesy, eyerollying kind (and I usually HATE fan-service).

Although the movie isn't perfect and it was an impossible task to live up to all fan expectations... I thoroughly enjoyed the ride and was smiling the entire length of the movie. It truly brought out the nostalgic child in me. This was a Star Wars movie for true Star Wars fans.

ROS had to deal with the issues that the fans had with TLJ, even though there are issues with the dialogue and overall pacing of the movie, the movie delivers what the fans wanted. Great action, the music is amazing, Rey, Ben Solo and Palpatine are the standouts of the movie. Rushed, but somewhat satisfying conclusion to the Skywalker saga.
best possible ending with having the responsibility of putting two movies in one since episode 8 didn't further the overall story set up in 7. props to JJ and cast.

The Last Jedi was terrible but at least it left us set up for Rey to be the reincarnation of Anakin to finally bring balance to the force. Instead we got... no imagination, no love, discontinuing of aspects that have always been in the core of Star Wars and super fast action sequences. If you aren't a massive Star Wars fan and just want to see good versus evil in such an extreme way it feels like a poorly written video game about devils and angels then you'll probably enjoy it. This isn't Star Wars. 

Hopefully someone buys Star Wars from Disney and starts again at episode 7. This is not at all in the style of George Lucas and even defies things pre-established from previous movies.
A great way to finish the saga üëçüèª
